revised_title: Tercentenary Gifts to the Royal Society
tldr: This article discusses various gifts presented to the Royal Society on the occasion of its tercentenary in 1961. The gifts include a silver handbell from Queen Elizabeth II, a geological map made from semi-precious stones, and a crystal bowl with signatures of the Society's officers. The article highlights the craftsmanship and significance of these gifts as tokens of appreciation for the Society's contributions to science.
